metadata.title: CVE-2022-46871 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
An out of date library (libusrsctp) contained vulnerabilities that could potentially be exploited. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 108.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-46871` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libusrsctp-examples - 0.9.5.0-2
libusrsctp2 - 0.9.5.0-2
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
No subscription required

notes.note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 22.04, the firefox package is just a script that installs the Firefox snap sbeattie> libusrsctp fixed upstream in 0.9.4.0 specific issue is a failure to perform reference counting correctly, and thus race conditions that lead to use-after-frees are possible.

criterions.comment: libusrsctp package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.9.5.0-2').
mozjs78 package in kinetic is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1').
